Title: Tacit Knowledge Elicitation for Shop-floor Workers with an Intelligent Assistant
Authors: Samuel Kernan Freire, Chaofan Wang, Santiago Ruiz-Arenas, E. Niforatos
Abstract summary: An intelligent assistant system can support the elicitation of tacit knowledge from workers through systematic reflection.

Title: Tacit knowledge elicitation process for industry 4.0
Authors: Enzo Fenoglio, Emre Kazim, Hugo Latapie, A. Koshiyama
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a tacit knowledge elicitation process for capturing operational best practices of experienced workers in industrial domains for Industry 4.0.

Title: Federated AI Chat System: Tackling Tacit Knowledge Management
Authors: J. Seo, B. Cui, C. Rong
Venue: 85th EAGE Annual Conference & Exhibition (including the Workshop Programme)
Abstract summary: A federated AI system named GPTWell is proposed to manage tacit knowledge in the oil and gas sector.

Title: A Tacit-Knowledge-Based Requirements Elicitation Model Supporting COVID-19 Context
Authors: Hamnah Anwar, Saif Ur Rehman Khan, J. Iqbal, Adnan Akhunzada
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a conceptual model to effectively elicit tacit knowledge-based requirements in software development, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: INFLUENCE FACTORS OF THE TACIT KNOWLEDGE ELICITATION PROCESS: SYSTEMATIC LITERATURE REVIEW
Authors: Cláudio Roberto do Rosário, Fernando Gonçalves do Amaral
Venue: International journal of knowledge engineering and management
Abstract summary: This paper reviews factors influencing the process of tacit knowledge elicitation, but does not specifically address challenges in the context of AI systems and DER operations.

Title: Capturing tacit knowledge for spacecraft operations at ESOC
Authors: R. Mugellesi-dow, S. Pallaschke, Oriol Gallemi Rovira
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the challenges in capturing tacit knowledge from experts for spacecraft operations, but does not specifically address AI systems or DER operations.

Title: Integration of DERs on power systems: challenges and opportunities
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the challenges and opportunities in integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into power systems, but does not specifically address tacit knowledge elicitation for AI systems in DER operations.

Title: Capturing Tacit Knowledge in Security Operation Centers
Authors: Selina Y. Cho, J. Happa, S. Creese
Abstract summary: This paper examines the use of tacit knowledge by security analysts in security operations centers, but does not address challenges in tacit knowledge elicitation for AI systems in DER operations.
